author: Xilophor
name: Content Warning MonoMod Mod Template
description: A mod template for mods using the MonoMod code injection lib.
symbols/ModGuid/description: The global identifier specific to your mod. (Ex. username.ModName)
symbols/Version/description: The initial version of your mod, in semantic versioning. (Ex. 1.0.0)
symbols/PluginsDirectory/description: The file path of the plugins folder, for using the HookGen (On.x & IL.x) and copying the plugin for quick testing. This is typically located in your profile folder if you're using r2modman or Thunderstore.
symbols/GameDirectory/description: The file path of the main Content Warning folder, for referencing assemblies from the game.
symbols/VanillaCompatible/description: Set the vanilla compatibility. Setting false will disable matchmaking with vanilla clients, but will allow you to spawn custom network objects.
symbols/ReferenceGameLibsPackage/descrip: Use the GameLibs NuGet Package to avoid manually referencing game files. If you fill the game directory field, this will only apply for Continuous Integration.
symbols/PublicizeGameAssemblies/descript: Publicize the Game Assemblies to access internal or private classes, fields, methods, and properties.
symbols/UseHookGen/description: Use AutoHookGenPatcher to easily hook into the game. Only disable if you know what you are doing.
symbols/CopyPluginOnBuild/description: Whether the built assembly should be copied to your plugins directory after building.
symbols/UseMinVer/description: Instead of manually changing the mod version, use MinVer and automatically update the mod version based off of git tags (ie 'v1.2.3'). Only enable if you are using git vsc (ie GitHub).
symbols/GlobalPluginUsing/description: Adds a global using for the main class with alias 'Plugin' so you can easily use 'Plugin.Logger'.
